Expectation1: Support each other emotionally during tough times
Situation1: One sibling has just received some very difficult news and is deeply distressed by it.
Expectation2: Listen actively and provide emotional support when needed.
Situation2: Your I04iend calls you in the middle of the night, crying, because they just received some devastating family news.
Story: It was just past midnight when I heard my stepbrother’s muffled sobs through the thin wall between our rooms. He’d just found out his dad was moving away for good, and I knew he needed me. I sat on the edge of my bed, torn, when my phone buzzed. It was my best friend, Sam, calling. Her voice was shaky, barely holding together as she told me her grandmother had passed away. She needed me, too—needed me to listen, to be there, to help her through the pain. I could hear my stepbrother’s crying getting louder, and I felt the weight of both worlds pressing down on me. I was supposed to be the one who held things together for my family, the one who was always there for my friends. But right now, I couldn’t be in two places at once. My heart ached as I sat frozen, phone in hand, listening to Sam’s sobs and my stepbrother’s grief, knowing that whatever I chose, I’d be letting someone down.
